subject: Marketing
title: Ethical Frameworks for Teams
description: A fast breakdown of Ethical Frameworks for Teams for builders.

hook.text: A marketing team shipped a campaign they all felt uneasy about. Nobody spoke up.

buildup.text: Without ethical frameworks, teams default to 'what works' rather than 'what's right.'

discovery.text: Ethical checklists, pre-mortems, and designated devil's advocates prevent groupthink.

twist.text: The team that pauses to ask 'should we?' often avoids crises the fast team creates.

climax.text: Ethical culture comes from systems and ritualsâ€”not just good intentions.

punchline.text: Good systems beat good intentions every time.

quiz.question: What helps marketing teams make ethical decisions?
options: Ethical checklists, pre-mortems, and devil's advocates
Hiring only people with ethics degrees
Letting the most senior person always decide
